raw_text:
Hollywood hunts hits at Sundance
 
 The Sundance Film Festival, the movie industry's top destination for uncovering the next independent hits and new talent, opens on Thursday.
 
 The event will see screen executives decamp from Hollywood to Park City, Utah, for 11 days to search for low-key movies that could make it big in 2005. Open Water, Napoleon Dynamite, Garden State and Super-Size Me were all snapped up at last year's festival. But stars like Keanu Reeves and Pierce Brosnan also have films showing there. The festival is being opened by a screening of quirky comedy Happy Endings, starring former Friends actress Lisa Kudrow and Maggie Gyllenhaal, on Thursday.
 
 Kudrow's Friends co-star, David Schwimmer, plays a divorced drunkard in Duane Hopwood, while Brosnan stars as a hit man in comedy The Matador. Keanu Reeves appears in coming-of-age tale Thumbsucker while Kevin Costner and Michael Keaton are among the other big names whose films are involved. Robert Redford founded Sundance in 1981 and it has gone on to showcase future successes such as Reservoir Dogs, The Blair Witch Project and The Full Monty. But it has received criticism that it has become more commercial and mainstream over the years. "As much as the press argues that Sundance has completely changed, it hasn't changed that much," festival director Geoffrey Gilmore said. "It's still a place for discovery. It's a place for common ground among film-makers and audiences more than it is the celebrity stuff." Other films generating interest before this year's festival include Hustle & Flow, about an aspiring rapper, The Squid and the Whale, an autobiographical film by writer-director Noah Baumbach, and comedy/drama Pretty Persuasion. It also has two new international cinema competitions.

I notice that the festival will be open for 11 days from Thursday. There are a lot of films being shown: Open Water, Napoleon Dynamite, Garden State, Super-Size Me, and others with stars like Keanu Reeves and Pierce Brosnan. The screening starts with "Happy Endings," which is quirky comedy.

Then there's some drama scenes where David Schwimmer plays a drunk friend in Duane Hopwood and Pierce Brosnan plays a hitman in The Matador. On the big screen, Keanu Reeves is playing an 18-year-old coming-of-age tale called Thumbsucker, along with Kevin Costner and Michael Keaton.

The festival was founded by Robert Redford in 1981 and has showcased films like Reservoir Dogs, The Blair Witch Project, and The Full Monty. It's criticized for being more commercial, but it still finds new hits like Hustle & Flow, The Squid and the Whale, Pretty Persuasion, and two international competitions.

I should make sure to include all these elements without adding extra information or explanations. Just a concise summary highlighting key points about the event, the films on show, and its criticisms.
</think>

The Hollywood Film Festival at Sundance will open on Thursday for 11 days of film discovery in 2005. It screens "Happy Endings," starring Lisa Kudrow and Maggie Gyllenhaal. Key films include Open Water, Napoleon Dynamite, Garden State, Super-Size Me, and Thumbsucker with Keanu Reeves, Kevin Costner, and Michael Keaton. The festival also features acts of humor like The Squid and the Whale and Pretty Persuasion, as well as two international competitions.

Highly anticipated films including Keanu Reeves' Happy Endings, former Friend star David Schwimmer's The Matador, and Kevin Costner's role in The Matador are among those being featured at the festival. Despite criticism that the festival has become more commercial and mainstream over time, director Geoffrey Gilmore argues it remains a place for discovering new talent. This year's festival opens on Thursday with an opening screening of romantic comedy Happy Endings starring Keanu Reeves. Other films showing at the Sundance Film Festival include The SquiD, an auto-biographical film by writer/director Noah Bauchau and Hustl&Flow, an aspiring rapper's autobiography.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Sundance Film Festival, the movie industry's premier event, will be held from January 15 to 26 in Park City, Utah. The festival is known for its eclectic mix of independent films, many of which have gone on to become major hits and earn critical acclaim. This year, several notable movies are scheduled to appear at the festival, including Quirky comedy Happy Endings, starring Lisa Kudrow and Maggie Gyllenhaal, and comedy The Matador, in which Keanu Reeves plays a drunk who becomes involved with a hit-and-run accident. Other notable films in the lineup include The Blair Witch Project, directed by Mike Flanagan and starring DeWane Hopwood, and The Full Monty, based on the British comedy of the same name, which is directed by Robert Redford. Both films are expected to gain attention at the Sundance Film Festival due to their unique styles and themes.
